channel.title: I can't set up my server. I portforwarded, opened it in my firewall, idk what el
channel.description:
I port forwarded my airport extreme correctly: [IMG]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/5443/portforwardxu5.jpg[/img]
I've correctly given myself an internal ip out of the range that can be auto set (200+): [IMG]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/5665/correctinternalipja0.jpg[/img]
And I've configured my windows vista firewall to allow port 43594: [IMG]http://img228.imageshack.us/img228/3094/windowsfirewallporteb4.jpg[/img]
and here are some other images regarding my airport extreme configuration: [IMG]http://img367.imageshack.us/img367/9692/picture3ir5.png[/img] [IMG]http://img367.imageshack.us/img367/2650/picture2vw8.png[/img]
And here's what I get when I check the port (before it said connection refused instead of this): [IMG]http://img254.imageshack.us/img254/8692/timeoutlo7.jpg[/img]
What am I missing? THANKS FOR EVERYTHING GUYS!

item.title: I can't set up my server. I portforwarded, opened it in my firewall, idk what el
item.dc:creator: @rnc505 rnc505
item.description:
@rnc505 wrote:

Some of the pictures are from a mac because my computer is a MacBook Pro with Bootcamp Vista Ultimate.

The vista works exactly the same as normal vista on a windows only computer (like a dell or hp).

Its easier to show the settings from the mac partition because of a built in screenshot program to the operating system.

The settings on the mac = the ones on the vista partition.

PLEASE HELP ME! I really want to do this. If I do release a server I give admin/mod status, I think.

I’ve been slaving over this for almost a week. THANKS!

Read full topic
